Reviews.Title: “Worst Morriott Ever”
Reviews.Author: suman g
Reviews.Content: I thought all Marriott's are same and compared this to the one to the Marriott in Minnetonka, MN where I stayed for couple days.We stayed in Chicago Marriott O'Hare for one night, and reserved 2 rooms(two couples). It was the Worst Marriott ever I stayed in. There is no water, no coffee machine in the room. The room is not spacious at all, The service isn't good. Any motel/Hotel (like a small motel in small towns, or any other Choice Motels) will give a complementory Breakfast, But this location has nothing like that. We stayed there for a night, and it was the bad sleep we ever had. I would suggest people to pick the cheaptest Motel than to this Marriott, you will be more comfortable there than here.

Reviews.Title: “Run down, but under renovation”
Reviews.Author: DrTom234
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Marriott in March for a meeting at the O’Hare Plaza next door. I arrived at the airport at midnight. There is a shuttle to the airport that runs every 20 minutes. This is very convenient, but it will take you nearly 20 minutes to walk through the airport tunnels to the shuttle stop. We were picked up in the most run-down shuttle of all the busses I saw from other hotels, but the driver was polite. The shuttle stops at the Marriott Suites first before going to the Marriott, so figure on a 15-minute drive. The hotel was under construction when I was there and the entry was a bit of a mess. Check-in at the temporary reception desk on the third floor was prompt. The exterior of the hotel looks like a run-down motel with a running balcony that allows anyone to walk along right outside your window. The sidewalk was crumbling in places. Several wings were closed down for renovation. Once in the room, thought, it was clear that they are serious about their renovation. The rooms had new or updated furniture and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was small and cramped but with all new appointments and an excellent shower. The rooms have a flat screen TV with Pay per view and sleek new telephones. The Wi-fi worked well. It made me agree to a charge, but the charge didn’t show up on my bill. The bar stayed open until midnight but I didn’t use it. There is both an outdoor and indoor pools and fitness center, but I did not use these. If you are going to a meeting with the NBOME or the Lutheran Center, this is the most convenient location but it is still a 10 minute walk through winding cooridors (I'm glad I had a map). There are nice restaurants within a 10-minute taxi ride. Overall, I was happy with the room even though the exterior was not impressive and you can occasionally hear an airplane flying overhead.

Reviews.Title: “Construction is barely noticeable.”
Reviews.Author: Moustacio D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing a major $40 million construction and they have gone to great lengths to make sure it does not interfere with the guests. It had paid off. They have moved the Registration area and bar area, but have done a good job of making sure it doen't seem make-shift. We had some business meetings there and the staff was very attentive and did a great job of making sure we had our drinks,snacks and meals. A couple things that I felt were lacking. I could not get the room temperature down enough. I dropped the thermostat down to its lowest level but I could not cool off. I talked with other co-workers and they had the same experience. Also, the water was cloudy out of the tap but eventually disappated. Not sure if it was supposed to do that. Other hotels will usually leave a sign warning you of this type of situation, but there was no sign. The weight room had some old, outdated equipment. I did like the newly remoldeled rooms and the large shower head. The TV was big but did not appear to have a digital signal, only analog. And the staff was very, very nice. Their service really stood out.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay - Excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Sara L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as we had an overnight layover in Chicago. We booked in advance and paid only $99 for our room for the night - a great value for the quality of hotel and service. Our room had been recently renovated and was spotless! The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was modern and new and the room was clean and well-appointed. We took the complimentary shuttle to and from the airport and it ran right on schedule. The hotel and shuttle service staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, we would definitely stay here again if connecting overnight in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice stay at Marriott”
Reviews.Author: depechegirl02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and had an extremely pleasant stay. My room was comfortable, clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and always greeted me when I entered the hotel. Itâ€™s right by the airport and the free shuttle service to Oâ€™Hare was timely as well. The only reason I didn't give this an "Excellent" is the $24 parking, too expensive in my opinion. Aside from that, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “way impressed - hard to do”
Reviews.Author: CruisinChris1
Reviews.Content: So, I had colleagues stay here mid-summer last year and we all dined here. To say that it was lackluster is an understatement. I arrived here today, frankly vaguely unaware that I had been booked here (having a different ORD hotel in mind) and felt deflated. I was more deflated when I saw the massive evidence of refurb going on. HOWEVER, from the moment I approached the door - I was impressed. There were many staff to show me to the temp lobby (new one almost ready) and the desk staff were cheerful and above and beyond. I am a world traveler and super picky and these guys handled my grumpiness with the surprise refurb and need to drop a rental car fantastically. If they didnt' know they got answers. All I ask. The rooms are very well re-done - including everything in the bath - tile tub, everything. Nicely paneled doors, beautiful carpets with lime highlights against a natural background. Even the temporary lounge on floor three is beautiful and tells of things to come. The staff - all - are doing a fantastic job of being attentive and the property has received the facelift it deserved. The only negatives would be that the room on floor 10 has a lot of noise bleed from highway and was is apparently tinting on windows looks like continual fog (though it filters a strong west view of sun). I would actually come back!! And again, well done and service great!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away until the renovations are complete.”
Reviews.Author: BGK1951
Reviews.Content: Hotel is undergoing significant renovations and both facilities and service are suffering. If you are looking for an overnight stay at O'Hare use the Marriott Suites, at least until the renovations here are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this hotel. The hotel is in the process of a major renovation,but the staff is very helpful in navigating through it. The room was very nice and the service is excellent. The hotel shuttle is very convenient. THe restaurant has good food at a reasonable price with great service. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation will just add!”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Adventure
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Chicago O'Hare property (on Higgins) is undergoing renovation and is a bit awkward. . . but never mind! The service here is better than ever--Angela (Guest Service Agent) is a real pro and one of the most pleasant Marriott coworkers I've ever experienced. But wait. . . there's more. The rooms are terrific--pristine and comfy. The bed(s) are great!! New carpeting and appointments are fresh and clean. When out at the airport, stay here. General Manager Dieter Heigl pays attention to all the details and will have a gem of a place when renovation is complete in the spring. Keep up the great work at Marriott Airport O'Hare. It's only going to get better.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid during Renovation”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here until their renovation is complete. The shuttle was very slow coming to pick us up from the airport so from the time I landed it took an hour to get to my 'airport' hotel. As worldtraveler4971 said, the driver was very friendly so that helped. But unfortunately things were not much better when I got to the hotel. The reception is on the 3rd floor so you have to take an elevator up to check in. Then to get to my room I had to walk for 5 minutes, pulling my luggage and computer through the middle of the dining room and around a corner and then down a hall and back down on an elevator and all the way to the end of another hall on a ground floor room. Very inconvenient. I got lost trying to find the elevator as no one told me that I had to walk thru the middle of the dining room. So I had to drag my bags back to reception to ask for directions again. And still no one offered to help me with my stuff. I eventually did get to my room. I apparently was in one of the renovated rooms and the room itself was OK but still not quite working (issues with TV, etc.). The main problem, however, is that it seemed deserted in this section and dark and dingy. And looking out into a dark courtyard at ground level with no one else around just didn't feel safe. Felt like I was staying in a strip motel where you would pay $59. Room service man was very nice but the food was not great, salmon was fried vs grilled and just not what I expected for the price. I hope things will get better when the renovations are done but for now I'd recommend you go someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler4971
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this airport hotel as a result of a missed connection. My choices were a $299 stay at the airport Hilton within the airport or $79 at this Marriott undergoing renovation. My loyalty to the Marriott and the price prompted me to choose this airport hotel. The free shuttle bus that is offered is not convenient. I had to walk 15 minutes to get to it and this hotel is the last drop off. Given it was midnight and I had been delayed due to weather by many hours, i was not happy. The driver, however, was delightful with a very positive attitude which makes a huge difference. In hind sight, however, I should have taken a cab which would have allowed me to get there sooner and get to bed earlier so I could get a 6am flight the next morning. Arriving at the hotel was a disappointment as it was completely under renovation. Again, the staff were quick, responsive, and pleasant but the navigation around the construction sight and the confusing hotel logistics added more stress to an already stressful situation. Hotel room was just OK. If I'm diverted through O'Hare again, I'll not stay here until the construction is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay until renovation finishes”
Reviews.Author: dssrriri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decent but undergoing a massive renovation. Many inconveniences as a result. No lobby, many elevators to get anywhere, long walks in lonely corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as some would have you believe...”
Reviews.Author: AUBeachPotato
Reviews.Content: Yes it's undergoing a renovation but it did not hinder my stay at all. Most people don't travel to another city to eat at the restaurant in the hotel. If that's your thing, then you might be somewhat disappointed. I wasn't at all. The staff were courteous and eager to help. You can't ask for much more than that. All in all...an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the ideal location, but a fairly good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelFotog77
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip to Chicago and booked a little late, so the choice was stay downtown for $400 or outside the city for much less. We ended up finding this for $130 by the airport, a fair price for Chicago even with a 15 minute drive to the city. Though under a major renovation, the rooms were clean and comfortable. While the breakfast room was a make-shift dining area, the food was surprisingly good and service excellent. Only complaint would be the tiny bathroom and waking up at 3am to the smell of someone smoking. Since there were no adjoining rooms, I'm guessing this was employee in the storage area next to us. It's far better to book ahead and stay closer to downtown. If you need to stay close to the airport, this isn't a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Major renovation underway through February 2012”
Reviews.Author: TinySwimmer
Reviews.Content: This was one of the first 10 Marriott Hotels ever built and was really showing its age. It is undergoing a $40M upgrade. Unfortunately, that leaves things a bit of a mess. No lobby. No real restaurant. No pool. Lots of noise and mess. Unless you get a really good deal and don't mind putting up with some inconvenience, stay in one of the hundred other hotels near O'Hare airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room - Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: Robin R
Reviews.Content: For a layover hotel near enough to O'Hare to supply free shuttle service, you will be hard pressed to find a better value while they are undergoing a FULL renovation. As of early October, all the rooms are done and the beds are super comfortable and everything else is NEW. They have full service bar and dining -albeit in temporary quarters - but you can get a decent meal and a drink and what else do you need? Take advantage of a high quality room and first class service at bargain prices while the lobby and exterior are being remodeled over the next six months.

Reviews.Title: “REMODELING”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelkc
Reviews.Content: In mid-September I had the unfortunate opportunity to staty at the Chicago Marriott -O'Hara. I was attending a class at the AMA so this location was very convenient. At no time until my arrival was I told that the hotel was being remodeled. Due to flight delays, I arrived around midnight. The shuttle bus driver explained that he taking us through the back door due to remodeling. The elevator up to the "check in" area could only accommodate three people (I thought I was in Europe). At check in, we were told that the computers just went down. They were able to give us a room but no key. So I was escorted to my room by one of the two check in personnel. There was at least seven people in line behind me. I was told when the computer came up, they would slide the room key under my hotel room door. Never happen. Traveling alone - this gave me an awful feeling...I could not leave my room. To add insult to injury, my room had a strong musty smell. I stayed on the first floor - A section. The next day, I did ask for another room and was promptly given one in the B Section -third floor. This room was much better. The hotel is huge - ranch style - so you go through a long maze to find your room. The breakfast buffet was bad...if you have to eat there I suggest getting an omelet - it is made from scratch so it is hot. I don't know if you have ever used a hotel shuttle bus from O'Hara. That is an experience in itself. It is like a marathon with an obstacle course thrown in. I was exhausted when I finally arrived at the spot..which you don't really know if you are at the spot...because there is no signs or directions. This hotel does need to remodel...it is WORN. From a dissatisfied Marriott Rewards member.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: allison t
Reviews.Content: i love the hotel!!!!!! great hotel for great price!!! we stayed for a few nights like it very much!!!

Reviews.Title: “in transition”
Reviews.Author: kaityogill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is being remodeled. They tried hard to minimze hassle for travelers. Our room was in the finished section and very nice. We had a problem with parking and it was handled quickly for us. The location is perfect for the airport. We did a park and fly and the trip was only a few minutes. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near O'Hare”
Reviews.Author: Ctrigg1
Reviews.Content: Undergoing major renovation currently. Small rooms, but comfortable. Price may be a little high for the area and so far from downtown. Decent stay for conference/business setting.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what I was looking for.”
Reviews.Author: GFdC
Reviews.Content: Arrived there late at night and departed early in the morning, so I do not have a lot to add. Rooms were good and confy, toilet small. Staff very kind and professional though. If for any reason I have to sleep at O'hare again probably I will choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bigfanof88
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel. They are in the middle of renovating. Didn't bother us at all. Two huge outdoor pools. One indoor. Front desk wonderful. Restaurant and bar both Great! Parking lot procedures were new and not working well. But go thru it ok. I would most definitely stay again. The L is right there. Convenient for sneaking into the city. Great place. Will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Under Major Construction”
Reviews.Author: TommyTBoneMemphis
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel, not as close to the airport as you would think, whcih is a good thing for light sleepers and overhead jets .. . . Rooms are small, ok for single business travlers, would not recommend for families. Also, just know this hotel is under construction in a major way during Sept 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Being present at the recreation”
Reviews.Author: DoeHEAD
Reviews.Content: We got an amazing rate by virtue of attending a convention while this hotel is undergoing major renovation. And even though the construction forced the front desk to move to the third floor, and the breakfast set-up to somewhat awkwardly occupy some of the meeting rooms, the staff did a pretty good job of maintaining their cool, and providing a very high level of overall guest service while enduring some logistical strain. The hotel is of its time; appearing to have been built sometime around 1980. A two-story section surrounds two courtyards in which are located the indoor and the outdoor swimming pools. The indoor pool was not in use during my visit. The outdoor pool is spacious and especially attractive on a hot day. A twelve-story section anchors the entire complex, which also includes a large single-story conference wing adjacent to a large, toll-gated parking lot. Walkable from the hotel is an entrance to the Blue Line's Cumberland "L" station, which is just two stops from the O'Hare terminal. I stayed here four nights, during some of Chicago's hottest (and coldest) summer weather. The room was comfortable, if a tad small by today's standards. The only wrong note was the $24/day parking fee, which, considering that the lot was unmanned, was merely an expensive license to hunt for a space. There is much to recommend this hotel. It's no super high-end O'Hare Xanadu. But it has a leafy, hideaway feel despite being in the airport flightpath. And it provides considerable value for the money. No doubt once the renovations are completed, it will re-emerge even better.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced! Not accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Peller
Reviews.Content: 3 of us - friends, planned a get-together. We chose this hotel because we assumed it would be nice. This Marriott was more like a Days Inn. First they lost our reservation which was made a month in advance. Then, of course, they did not have the type of room we reserved which was a double bed suite with a pull-out sofa. Instead we had to have a king bed with a pull-out sofa and a roll-away bed. You can imagine that 2 of us were not that comfortable. Especially since the room was so small that you had to walk on the pull-out and roll away to get around the room. But one of the biggest nuisances was that we had to walk FOREVER (I am so not exaggerating) to get to our room. They were in the middle of renovations. No apologies to us, or any offers because of the inconvenience to us. We were put in the old part of the hotel and it was $150 a night. Even when I expressed that we were not satisfied - I heard, "Oh? Sorry." So not worth it. A good hotel would have tried to make us satisfied. And the elevators? I've never been in a smaller elevator in my LIFE. I don't know how you could even get a wheelchair on it.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: colbyRachmaninoff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pricey! My siblings and I stayed here for 2 nights for a 3-day convention, and although it was great we had a $89/night rate, there was a fee for parking ($24/day/vehicle) and a fee to use the Internet in one of the convention rooms ($20/day). I think they also charge Internet if you wanted to access it from your room, too, at about $12 or so dollars? I thought all the fees were overpriced. The hotel overall was very nice; staff was very helpful and professional; it was clean; our room was clean; had a big and open pool area. If you're staying here for one night and came by a taxi or shuttle bus, it's probably going to be really nice. If you're staying here for business, it's a decent place for that too (their theme screams business). But, if you're going to stay here for fun, I suggest you go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service and management I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: k c
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. Power went out in middle of night. No showers, no toilets, no food, no electricity for the entire day. When it was getting dark and power wasn't back on we needed to vacate because you couldn't see, their emergency back up lights weren't working, their phones were down, their computers were down, etc. They had no back up generator. They had No emergency plan. The management bailed around 1pm. They wouldn't help with alternative hotel arrangements. They wouldn't use their shuttle to get you to another hotel (since we were displaced). Didn't receive a bill until over 1 week later. They had overcharged us. We have called 4 x and have been promised a credit and it is now over 1 month later and no credit. They keep sending your call to manager voicemail and he never calls you back. I run a small business and we have better systems in place for such things. Can't believe the terrible customer care and lack of management or SOMEONE to return call and properly credit our CC.

Reviews.Title: “Arlington Million”
Reviews.Author: kyderby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chicago Marriott O'Hare on my recent trip to visit the Arlington Race Track for the Arlington Million. The Hotel was hard to find because they had bad lighting on the road in front. Let me say that the training at Marriott is outstanding. The service from the Shuttle Driver to the maids. I was picked up at the Airport, and was really impressed with the professionalism of the the driver. Upbeat and postive attitude that showed throughout the experience. I was got to the hotel, and the doorman met me with still a great attitude. The desk crew was attentive to my needs. Everyone addressed me as Mr.. The room was adequate, maybe bathroom was small, but the room was recently updated. When I ordered room service, everyone greeted me with Mr.. The hotel has two outside pools and one inside pool with jacuzzi. Two restaurants and great food. The only thing that seems cheap. You pay for the Marriott quality, which is experienced frequently, but you have to pay for internet in the room, and overnight parking. I think this would keep me from staying next time. I liked the professionalism, and attiudes of the employees, but, hey, paying for wireless internet and parking?

Reviews.Title: “Poor Facility”
Reviews.Author: SCHargis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott O'Hare for a business conference and was disappointed from the moment I stepped onto the property. The facility is worn and although they are renovating, the feel of the hotel is old and run down. I was "fortunate" enough to be stuck out in the "B" building which meant to get to your room you have to walk through the indoor pool area that was reminiscent of a steam bath. By the time we made it to the doors to re-enter the hotel and head to our room we were covered in sweat and condensation. There is no way around going through the swimming area, which we found ridiculous. It may be fine in the winter, but not in 110 degree weather. The hotel boasts "convenient accessability" to downtown via a train stop just behind the hotel. This is false. If you are looking for a hotel with easy access to downtown Chicago, this is not the hotel. First of all, to get to the entrance to the train you have to walk to the back of the building which is not lighted and is a haven for homeless people (we encountered one on the way back our first night urinating in the elevator). There are no doors in the back of the hotel to avoid walking around the entire building outside (not fun in 110 degree weather). . Additionally, they have locked the gate between the parking lot of the hotel and the train area and provide a special code to access. Each night as we tried to maneuver our way back to the hotel, the code wouldn't work and the gate would stick. There are security guards hanging out by the front door of the hotel, but we never found one working the area behind the hotel near the train access. If you want to go downtown and don't want to take a train, its an $80 cab fare round trip (plus tip). Our room was dirty and there was hair in the bathtub and in the floor of the bathroom. The sheets smelled musty and overall the room felt and appeared dirty. Also, if you are on a business trip and need access to a computer with printing capabilities, you must scan a credit card that holds your account for $80 for 48 hours. There is no way around this so if you need a 5 minute computer to print one document as I did, then you have to give up $80 of credit on your card until they remove the charges. This is ridiculous as most hotels have a system where access to printers is free, and if there is a charge it ranges from $7- $12 for 15 minute increments and does not hold your card with ridiculous fees. All in all this is not a good representation of the Marriott brand. I would not recommend this facility for any reason. Pay the extra and stay inside the city.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Mavpav
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days for business. I booked a suite for a little extra room and it was large and comfortable. Shuttle to the airport was nice and convenient. Hotel food left a little to be desired but it was good enough for my purposes. There is a pizza joint next door that you can walk to that is decent. Work out room was never crowded when I was there. Everything was clean and kept up. Parts of the hotel seemed older or maybe longer since they were rennovated, but my room was new, clean and sparkly....I did kind of screw up on the reservation, but I blame the hotel for not really explaining it well: The suite comes with privileges to the executive lounge where you can get breakfast and drinks etc, but the hours are limited and it was closed for part of my stay. So I was paying for the suite and the privileges but did not get to take advantage of them.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Four Seasons, not Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: eyerep74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and unfortunately, the hotel is currently under renovation so my stay was just ok. I got an old room even after I asked for a new room which was disappointing. The check in agent even had the nerve to tell me that there were some available, but there weren't any left for people in "my" group. Nice. Especially after my employer blew a wad on having a corporate meeting there. In my opinion, we all should've been placed in new rooms. Having said that, I will say that my old room wasn't as bad as my coworkers had said it would be. My bed was comfy and my pillows were perfect so I was fine. Other than my experience with the girl at check-in, the staff at this hotel was phenomenal! It can't be easy working in an environment that is probably hectic for them since they are under construction so I commend them on their professionalism. The food was also very good. Not the bland hotel banquet food I was expecting at all. I was completely surprised by the variety that was offered too. High marks for the kitchen! I did get a chance to see one of the new floors that was completed and I have to say that when the renovation is complete this will be a very very nice hotel. I have to be forgiving because all you can do with an old hotel is make it better by renovating it. Unfortunately, that requires going through some growing pains. If the staff and food stay the same this will be a great hotel to stay at in the future. I would stay there again when it is complete. In the meantime, I highly suggest trying to get a new room.

Reviews.Title: “being renovated, needs it!”
Reviews.Author: aer
Reviews.Content: I usually love the Marriotts I stay in but this one wasn't quite up to standards. I was here for a convention (not business) being held at the hotel. The convention was wonderful, no complaints about food, service or anything there. The rest of the hotel is going through much needed renovations. I asked for a room in the garden wing walking out to the pool. The first one they gave me was overlooking the 2nd pool which was locked. Most of the rooms in this courtyard area were being renovated so a lot of the doors into the hotel corridores were locked. I went to the front desk the next morning and they were very nice and moved me into another room by the indoor/outdoor pool. They also said that a friend coming in later that day would have the room next to me. When she checked in they originally assigned her a room far away from mine. When I asked why they were able to find one down the hall. I think the problem was one room next to me had been renovated and seemed to be a model for the others -empty while I was there with the light on all the time. There were lights left on in the majority of the rooms being renovated also. I look for hotels that are on the "green" side so the waste of energy bothered me. Also there were no recycling containers anywhere in the hotel. Cans were thrown away with garbage. Hopefully this will be fixed when the hotel is finished. One other weird note, the housekeeper kept taking the soap I had partially used. I put one bar back in the box so she would leave it and she took that and another unopened one! The rooms are definately dated and need to be upgraded but the room I saw that seemed to be finished looked very nice. The carpet is worn and dirty. I needed a refrigerator for my medicine I had to call 2x for it in the 2nd room. I got one right away in the 1st room. I should have asked for it to be transferred because the one I got never went below 50 degrees. I carry a thermometer because my medicine cannot be frozen. I never asked for another one but I did hear that someone elses refrigerator quit working after a night. I hope these are being replaced also. I needed freezer packs to be frozen for the way home and the front desk had me take them into the restaurant. The person there was very nice but when I went to pick them up the restaurant was closed and it took a long time for the front desk to get them. Food: I had lunch one day in the restaurant it was very good. Some of my friends went to breakfast there and said that was really good too. Gino's East is right next door and there is a good grocery store on the corner for supplies or take out food. I also got a Giordano's pizza delivered to the room one night, expensive but well worth it. A small is enough to feed 2-4 people

Reviews.Title: “Don't be deceived, it's not that close to the airport.......”
Reviews.Author: Scar1925
Reviews.Content: I'm a Gold member with Marriott and I typically am satisfied with this brand. However, thinking I'd be saving time by staying here versus in the city was a mistake. The desk staff was not very efficient and neither was the shuttle service from and to the airport. They say the shuttle service runs at 20 minute intervals; however, it was more like every 30. I ended up taking a cab back to the airport. My room was one of the updated ones, with flat screen TV's and a nice, new bed; however, the lack of true convenience to the airport is a real downer for a hotel whose name includes the airport. Wouldn't stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Dated and dirty”
Reviews.Author: dsprep
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice, but that couldn't make up for an expensive stay in a really lousy old Marriott. Windows were dirty I stayed away Fromm restaurant. Not up to Marriott full service standards

Reviews.Title: “The Rooms that are Renovated are great”
Reviews.Author: JohnBlaze28
Reviews.Content: The staff, valet, and the associates were all great. They were very polite and very helpful. It is under renovation right now, but we were lucky enough to be given an updated room. It had a nice flat screen tv, nice shower, the bathroom was somewhat small though. The bed was excellent, very big and comfortable. Internet was not free though, it was pricey, 12.95 / day. The bar wasn't too expensive, for my beer, but my wifes martini was just under $12. It is a great location though. A movie theater is near by "Muvico", plenty of restaurants. Sitting out at the pool was nice, but you could hear the planes taking off very loudly, didn't bother me though.

Reviews.Title: “Need a good remodelling”
Reviews.Author: Tuareg72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient close to the airport. Lobby is fine, restaurant and bar are ok. The room I had was standard on lounge floor. Old TV old furniture they definetly need a fresh remodelling for it. Parking is expensive and NO FREE INTERNET brings me back in the early 2000s... not acceptable any longer. I rather use the close by SPRING HILL SUITES by Marriott... but at that time it was sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Great option to stay around the ORD airport”
Reviews.Author: tooreck
Reviews.Content: All you can expect from a Marriott hotel + great and extraordinary helpful staff. They helped me a great deal with a package I needed to ship, providing a box, tape and label printing. A 24-hrs open big grocery Dominic's (Safeway) store is in a 5-minutes walking distance and the area is perfectly safe. Currently they're going through a renovation and getting to your room may be a challenge due to some close corridors (but this is transient = my price was promotional, below $100) yet the rooms are clean and high quality. Shuttle goes every 20 minutes, reliably and with courteous driver. Swimming pool is fantastic - divided into external and indoor, but it's one very large pool (you swim through a special divider).

Reviews.Title: “Under construction, rooms need upgrading”
Reviews.Author: osprey38
Reviews.Content: Current construction occurring at this hotel, I should know as my room was right beside it; construction was not overly loud however. My room was musty and dingy, carpet worn out (not sure if construction is room renovations or not). Also, I feel a hotel of this class, and definitely for the price, should have at the very least flat screen TV's, if not HD: old standard TV is what I got. Overall not a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near O'Hare and the "L"”
Reviews.Author: bobcatts
Reviews.Content: We were there for four nights. It's a great location near the O'hare airport with a free shuttle service that leaves on the hour every 20 minutes. Plus the (blue line) Cumberland train station is right across the parking lot and is about a 35-40 min train ride to the Loop. The staff was very helpful. There is a very nice gym to workout with individual TVs and headsets on the machines. We wanted to swim in the pool but it was closed due to the rain one day and then the other days we were in the city so we ran out of time. We didn't eat in the restaurant so not sure of the quality. The only downfall about the hotel is that the noise is terrible. You can hear everything from the hallways in the rooms. Just keep your fan/AC running and it drowns out the noise. Despite that, we would stay there again because of the friendly staff, free shuttle and access to the "L."

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me??”
Reviews.Author: HugsforTTT
Reviews.Content: Yesterday there was a huge power outage in the Chicago area. All hotels were booked solid. Since we are platinum premier members, I called Marriott to locate a room. This was the only place available, other than downtown or Gurnee (we live on the Northshore near Winnetka/Wilmette). Anyway, checked in with Edward and received an "upgraded" room which was larger (and we have 2 small kids). The room was super far on the other side of the hotel, and it was horrible! It wrecked of a staleness. The carpets were filthy as my sons allergies began to startup. Just awful! I called and requested a room change. They gave us the same tired room on a different floor. I requested a "reinvented remodeled room" and the indicated that they were out. The rooms were going for $240 per night, but we could use points since my husband travels alot. He has been loyal to Marriott for years! When I told the Manager Amber (I believe this is her name), she could not provide a new room....so We Left!! I told her that my family cannot sleep in that awful room and to return our points! We operate on principal, for $240, this place is substandard and nothing even close to Marriott standards. And to use reward points doesn't matter ---my husband earned those points through travel and being away from our family, we don't use these arbitrarily! For the cost of the room, one can stay in rhe same type room at the Ritz or the Four Seasons (for perspective). Anyway, The hotel is very dated. Reviewed the room service menu and it's limited and does not have a kids menu -- you have to tell room service and they will provide the options for kids. Parking is $30 for overnight guests -- this is Chicago! I imagine that If you have a redone room and were with Marriott Rewards, and were flying into Chicago and had business to attend to across the street, then this hotel May work. If not, look elsewhere as I cannot recommend it at all! We did not stay here. After the episode with the manager, we checked out and decided to wing it at home. We lit candles in the dark and had cold showers this morning --- and it was still better than staying in that outdated facility that they are calling a Marriott property! Ugh!

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again, but only if forced.”
Reviews.Author: Sharkfin2011
Reviews.Content: Security concerns at this hotel are very lacking. Last week, I stayed at the Oâ€™Hare Marriott and my room did not even lock! So, anyone could have entered my room w/o a key card. When I complained to the manager, he came upstairs and had a novel solution â€“ wedge a chair between the door and bathroom wall (I canâ€™t make this stuff up â€“ I have a picture on FB of the â€œMarriott Chair Securityâ€� and am getting some pretty interesting comments). Apparently, safety & security is not a huge at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel for Airport”
Reviews.Author: MurphCork
Reviews.Content: 1) Hotel is very close to the airport and a courtesy bus is available 2) Hotel has free WiFi 3) Rooms are clean and modern 4) Hotel is close to EL 5) Late check out is not available but they do have a bag minding service 6) International phone calls eye wateringly expensive

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age, but functional....”
Reviews.Author: spg126
Reviews.Content: An older hotel with a lot of wear and tear, but the rooms are up-to-date with new comfortable beds. TV was an older clunky set. It never was turned on. Desk chair was old and tattered. But given my late arrival (10pm) and my early departure (430am) the next morning, it certainly did the trick. Concierge lounge functional, but nothing fancy. Lobby area adequate. Staff quite nice. Would not recommend staying there as a base of operations for an extended visit to Chicago. Would recommend for an overnight before a flight out in the morning. Note -- Airport shuttle makes one stop along the way to ORD, so build that into your buffer time for getting over there.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: caftan1874
Reviews.Content: Overall I have to say, I had a nice stay at this property. The pros: close to the airport; close walk to the CTA blue line; prompt shuttle service; friendly staff. The cons: it was hard for the three of us to stay in two double beds; hotel is quite outdated; some areas outside the hotel aren't lit very well at night, making it feel a little unsafe. It is about a half mile walk to the 7-11 and Dominick's grocery store. If you buy anything, keep in mind there are no refrigerators in the rooms. The pool area is quite nice, indoor/outdoor with a jacuzzi area too. I enjoyed my stay in Chicago and would use this hotel again if I were traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovating - smells like an old Best Western”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTripers
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was close to the airport. I arrived to check in at 1.30am (check out was planned for 6.30am) to find that there was no valet parking so I would need to pay for a complete 24hrs of parking rather than just the hours needed, which is offered during normal business hours. After check in I headed to my room, this was such a long walk that I should have called a Taxi. I opened the door to my room and as confronted by the smell of old wet carpet, cigarettes and a stale odour that informed me that the room had not been opened for quite some time. I jumped into the shower only to find mould! The bed is in need of replacement as it sloped to one side, I managed to listen to the neighbours TV for the rest of the night. When I checked out at 6.30am (only 5 hours) they were still happy to charge $244 (USD). This is clearly not the jewel in the Marriott crown.

Reviews.Title: “Very outdated soulless hotel”
Reviews.Author: Breedo
Reviews.Content: Arrived and drove to the designated registration area where I was pounced on by a very unfriendly man telling me I couldn't leave my car there to register - which is fine but there was no need for the manner in which he spoke to me. There was a very long line at the registration desk as there was some kind of a convention on but in fairness they were processing people quickly and the wait wasn't too bad. I opted for the larger suite rather than a basic room and after a very long walk from the elevator into one of the wings I arrived in my room. It's like something out of the early 90s, ancient old school TVs, no fridge, horrendous decor and fixtures. Tiny bathroom with no room to even move around - all in horrible aging white plastic. Dirty carpets. Fine if you need to be close to the airport but I would not recommend this hotel - the competition is just too great now and this hotel does not compete, it needs a revamp. I honestly didn't know there were places that still looked like this.

Reviews.Title: “Will look for another hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: kelbro1960
Reviews.Content: Not real impressed with this hotel. For the price, they should offer free in room wireless, but it costs $12.95 per day. I had a question concerning my bill but had to wait several hours to get an answer. The staff, while friendly, didn't seem particularly happy to be working there. They also charge for parking, $6.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Mauka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before a flight out of ORD. Picked this Marriott based on the recent, good reviews. I was given a room on the first floor that was the size of a broom closet. I could not believe it. It is hands down, the smallest room I've ever stayed in the USA. It was like a 1/2 sized room, only one night stand. The carpet is worn, the furniture is worn, the bed was barely larger than a twin. I wonder why I was put in the dungeon? No one, no guest of Marriott should ever be put in this room. It is ridiculous. No mini-bar either, and the sundry store closed at 8pm. I'm sure I was put in the worst room in the house, based on other reviews, it seems there are good rooms to be had, but I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ekalcin
Reviews.Content: Marriott standard service, but the staffs are very friendly. Breakfast buffet is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: twinner76
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Chicago Marriott O'Hare while attending a seminar at the AMA facility next door. After reading the reviews online, I was expecting and old, outdated airport hotel. When I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised to find a clean, bright, safe hotel with a courteous staff and great amenities. I arrived at 11pm and was surprised to find that all of the requests I had made in my reservation online were taken care of...quiet room, high floor, foam pillows. In addition, it was also nice to have full room service available at that hour. Yes, the room and bathroom were on the small side and not as updated as some hotels I've stayed in - but it was clean and quiet and that matter more to me than a flat screen TV. The next day, I learned that I didn't even have to leave my hotel to get to the AMA facility. This is especially nice for a women traveling alone without a car. I felt safe staying in this hotel, which again was more important than updated decor and a flat screen TV. Yes, the hotel could use some updating, but overall I think it was an outstanding choice. It is convenient to the AMA facility, has plenty of eating options either in the hotel or close by, and has a shuttle conveniently runs between the hotel and the O'Hare airport every twenty minutes. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accom, friendly staff, easy airport access”
Reviews.Author: Cindy_Louer
Reviews.Content: We overnighted here when flying through O'Hare and would stay here again when passing through. It's not right at the airport, but there's is a continuous shuttle that makes the few minute trip easy. We were glad to be accommodated with adjoining rooms so our young kids could be in one room and my husband and I in the other. The morning breakfast buffet was great and well-priced - lots of fuit, smoked salmon, made to order pancakes, omelets, etc.. The kids loved it. We didn't have a chance to use the pool,but it was a very good one for this type of property, surrounded by airy glass. Kids were looking at it longlingly through breakfast. Wait staff were the best, and extremely indulgent of the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Jeff48840
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for the first time for a business meeting. Location is great just off the Kennedy Expwy. Cumberland Ave. exit just east of the 294 interchange. Service was outstanding, staff were friendly and helpful. Room was somewhat dated but clean. The fitness center was an unexpected bonus: lots of new equipment and spotlessly clean. A good value worth a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a makeover”
Reviews.Author: DaveySF
Reviews.Content: I expected more from a Marriott - this hotel is decent, it is clean, and the bed was comfortable, and the shower was very good. BUT it is a hotel stuck in the 80's and is in need of a makeover/renovation. The green carpeting, nondigital thermostat, and CRT TV needs to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great O'Hare option”
Reviews.Author: RickyBobbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott by O'Hare for a business meeting and were pleasantly surprised by the service and value for the room price. Free shuttle to and from O'Hare, check-in was immediate and our rooms were available even in the morning. The place is huge and sprawling. Large, modern fitness center open 24/7. Room are a little outdated but clean and comfortable. On-site restaurant, gift shop and cafe. They charge for internet access in the room but it is free in the lobby and cafe. For us, the service stood out--employees were friendly and accommodating. For the price (around $100) this is a great value if you need to stay near O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the cost”
Reviews.Author: MBRTraveler
Reviews.Content: The property is certainly among the worst Marriott's I have stayed at in terms of overall quality. The room was small (tiny bathrooms in particular), the staff not particularly pleasant, the building generally drab and outdated, and the breakfast buffet was about as bad as any I have had at a Marriott property (how do you screw up an omelet?). That said, the weekend price was less than 1/3 the price of downtown hotels. So for the money it is a reasonable value. You can easily hop on the blue line "L" train to downtown since there is a stop located just beyond the parking lot. Plus the hotel has a convenient shuttle to/from O'Hare Airport. So if you want typical Marriott quality, this maybe isn't the hotel for you. However, if you want a convenient location and a good price value, I would recommend this hotel. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Goose54
Reviews.Content: Okay for a quick stay otherwise place is very dated and tad bit above a motel. The lobby and restaurants are updated but rooms, hallways etc. need help. Part of room section has motel feel balcony facing run down pool etc. Front desk staff was just okay was not very receptive when I asked for room change after they put me on ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special. Needs Updating.”
Reviews.Author: rooster3888
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in September of 2010. This hotel is pretty "blah," overall with little to recommend about it aside from as a quick place to stay if you need to stay near the airport and can get a reasonable rate. The decor is at least 15 years out of date. The rooms are pretty small and the furniture is about as old as the decor. I stayed in the "B" wing on the other side of the pool area, and the hallway smells like a basement. Oddly, the pool area is one of the few things to recommend about this hotel -- it has quite a nice set up, though nobody seemed to be using it when I was there. The restaurant and bar are decent enough, but overpriced. Speaking of overpriced: the parking is absurd, at $24 per day ($30 for valet), and wireless Internet access is equally as absurd, at $12.95 per day. If you have a car, there are some decent restaurants a few miles away. If you don't, you're stuck with the hotel restaurant, a pizza place (which is a must if you have never been to Chicago), or a couple of fast food joints. There is nothing else of any interest nearby. It is about a 45 minute ride on the "L" train to downtown. Overall, if you have to stay in Chicago for a couple of days and don't need or want to go downtown, the Marriott isn't a terrible option if you can get a good rate. It pretty much felt like staying at a Best Western or Ramada Inn, so don't expect too much. This is a place to lay your head, and not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel, Rude Staff - Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Edward557
Reviews.Content: A very tired old fashioned hotel with the following issues: Unpleasant check in staff. Half the lifts not working. Painfully slow internet. Poor sound proofing. I've stayed in 100+ Marriott hotels - this has to be worse!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: dannymn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days for a business convention/workshop. The hotel was a good price and the rooms were clean and well kept. We stayed in one of the wings which are only 3 floors instead of the main 9, but either way the pool was nice, hot tub was nice, and the only downside to the whole thing is the insane internet charge- I think $12/13? per 24 hours. They offer shuttle service to/from O'Hare, which is nice because I didn't need to get a cab either then. Subway is nearby and is capable of taking you anywhere in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beds Great, Parking Pricey”
Reviews.Author: pauladarmer
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a fun weekend...we drove and to park as a guest, it was $24 dollars a day. Yikes...I would almost expect that if we stayed downtown, which I recommend, but we were about 15 minutes from downtown. The room was ok, the beds were great. The bathroom was on the very small side. The pool was closed. I would not recommend staying here because of the parking.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, ugly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie3446
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference for two nights. The layout of the hotel is awful. The main part is a normal 9 floor hotel but there is a second three story motel looking section where I was housed. I was in the B section which was honestly a five minute walk through long corriders to the lobby. the rooms were extremely humid and smelled of mildew and age. The carpet was faded and the furniture was dusty. The staff was very friendly and really tried to overcome the nastiness of the hotel but it was too large of a task. Truly a bad experience. There are several very nice hotels very close including a Marriott Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: QSentry
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at the Marriott O'Hare and had a very positive experience. The front desk staff were outstanding - offered many positive recommendations about the area and were extremely helpful with room details. We enjoyed using the pool area and the breakfast buffet was excellent (though a little bit on the pricy side). I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone - great location and cheaper than staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Typical airport Marriott”
Reviews.Author: keb1234
Reviews.Content: I stay in Marriott hotels about 120 nights a year, and the ones close to the airport are typically not as up-to-date. This hotel is no exception, which is fine for one night before an early flight, but I would not stay here for a long period of time. The hotel had a surprisingly nice indoor/outdoor pool area, which is where I spent my afternoon. The concierge lounge had better food than a lot of the marriotts (more than just cheese and fruit), but the rooms still need to be updated a little. I might try the Marriott suites the next time that I am at O'Hare - our shuttle stopped there and it seemed a little more modern.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, needs to be upgraded a bit”
Reviews.Author: aer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a convention. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. They could use updating though. I did hear that there may be renovating later this year. We had a room on the 1st floor with a door leading out to the pool area. This was very nice since we could choose to walk outside or through the halls. I liked the indoor/ outdoor pool but thought it was a bit small for this size hotel. It was only later in the stay that I realized there was a 2nd pool. There was one hot tub which was crowded most of the time. Unfortunately the weather was not very good the weekend we stayed, instead of mid 80's as predicted it was high 60's and rained. The hotel had the a/c blasting in most of the conference rooms so some people were actually wearing their jackets! The internet was only free in the lobby. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good experience”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCat314
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during an overnight/layover to and from Tokyo. First off, the shuttle service was a bit confusing. We waited and waited and it never arrived, so I finally called and I was told that the shuttle does not automatically go to the International Terminal, that we need to call ahead. It turns out a lot of people didn't know that because when it finally showed up, a crowd of people hopped in. But other than that, I had no problems. The bus driver was really funny, told us a bit of history of Chicago, and gave us a tour of the surrounding hotels, lol. I thought he was entertaining! The front desk staff was professional and polite, the room was beautiful. The front desk staff was also helpful when we asked where we can find a good Chicago pizza. They gave us their personal recommendations and we were very pleased with it. In the morning when we were waiting for the bus to take us to the airport, the bus driver was back, and told us to wait in the lobby, that he would take care of our luggage so we wouldn't freeze outside. Now that is service! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “No late checkout?!”
Reviews.Author: DigitalErin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here purely because of a professional event taking place in the hotel. Myself and several dozen other guests were scheduled to take an exam from 7am until noon, then leave that afternoon. Check-out time is noon, and the desk clerk informed me when I checked in the previous day that they would not extend any late check-outs. How inconvenient to check out at seven am, when I would have been gone by 12:15 anyway. Also,the bar did not open until 2. Would have been nice to have a drink after that test! Instead we walked across the back parking lot to Gino's East for pizza (and beer). Complementary internet is only available in the lobby, and is painfully slow. Not sure why the alarm clock didn't go off, could have been user error. But they did offer a snooze option when scheduling the wake-up call. The radio did not work. I did appreciate the airline check-in computer located just off the lobby, where I was able to print my boarding pass easily.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dethman
Reviews.Content: there is really not all that much to mention about this hotel. it's near the airport for a quick stay, has a shuttle and is about a 5-6 minute walk from the cumberland station on the blue line. room was fairly clean, but the furniture and television were very old. internet is an extra $12 a day. nothing memorable about the bar downstairs. not a ton of stuff nearby. needed a room, and they had one at $150/night. seemed a bit overpriced to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JamesT71
Reviews.Content: I Stayed there for Christmas. I had a wonderful night watching television and resting up for a family get together. If you are from out of town and just need a relaxing atmosphere to put your thoughts in order and enjoy a quiet evening, I highly reccommend you try the Mariott hotel here. I had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: TCATHudsonValley
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel was the bed. After that though, I am used to nicer hotels. First room smelled of smoke, The second room had stacks of chairs outside of it. Third room was about a football field away from lobby where they serve weak coffee and charge for it. The wifi only works in the lobby and the ethernet connections are SLOW and they charge you anyway. I would never stay at this hotel again. Hard to get as much work done as I would wish.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: mnalgirkar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I got a super-low Priceline deal. However, everything about this hotel exceeded my expectations. The registration staff was very courteous, the wired Internet connection worked painlessly, and the room was nice and comfortable. I had a sore throat so I had bought a can of soup with me from the outside. Since the hotel had restaurants downstairs I was feeling a little awkward asking them about microwaving it. However I did with some hesitation and they not only let me microwave it in their restaurant but also gave me silverware to take to my room. And everything with a friendly smile. Overall, great customer service -- I am truly impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: jheisel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night between two flights at O'Hare. We liked its proximity to the airport -- shuttles come by about every 15-20 minutes and will get you to the hotel quickly. The hotel is not a 5* property but a decent 3-4* venue. It has three bars/restaurants on site, and has a half dozen more within a five minute walk. Also, it has a large supermarket nearby. We did not really need to look into any of its amenities, as we just needed a place to sleep between arriving and departing Chicago. It met that need quite well. However, I would note that due to its proximity to O'Hare -- one of the busiest airports in the world -- you will have an airplane flying overhead about every 10 minutes between 5am-10pm or so. If you're tired enough, this won't bother you, but if you're a light sleeper, you should look for somewhere with more soundproofing. Free internet only works in the lobby, for some reason, guests have to pay for it in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “glad priceline gave me a good deal on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BelgianAlien
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Close to the airport, complimentart shuttle - 5 minute walk to the train - Large clean rooms - Fridge in the room Cons: - $24 (after tax) per day per parking spot - $13 per day for an internet connection in the room - Restaurant in the hotel is not exactly "budget friendly" (about $30 per person) - Downtown Chicago is about a 45 minute train ride away. Luckily, we got a good deal on this hotel via Priceline. The bed was not what I have come to expect of Mariott. I have stayed at many other Mariott hotels and have found their beds really nice... not in this one. The service was OK, but not super. Staying there, it felt as if the hotel is taking the business they get from the airport for granted and the staff does little to nothing to make your stay memorable in any way.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it; I was lucky?”
Reviews.Author: Panguin
Reviews.Content: I called Marriott from O'Hare itself because of a mixup in travel schedule that led me arrive one day early. I got a $159 rate, which was not bad, considering that the conference hotel I was going to was going to charge me $100 more because the rooms at the conference rate had been sold out. (A review of that Marriott in Magnificent Mile to follow.) The room was clean; breakfast was all right--it was not included in the price so I took the continental menu; the bed was fine; reception was friendly. I arrived late so I took dinner there as well. The ribs were good. No complaints at all. And perhaps I was lucky but both coming and going, I did not wait even five minutes each time for the shuttle. Between the Marriott and the way overpriced Hilton, which I had stayed before, I would take this Marriott any time.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Worn Out - Living on the Airport Trade”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: The Marriott O'Hare is one of the older O'Hare area hotels and it is clearly showing its wear and tear. Partly because it has some built-in business, they have continued to cut corners. I have stayed there 7 times in the past year and finally felt the need to write a review. There are many other far better hotels in the O'hare area and some are even less expensive. The Marriott typically has larger meetings on property and the individual traveler gets lost. Breakfast is a very average buffett with very slow service (get your check when you get your coffee or you may be 20 minutes finding your server) and room service reminds one of the Holiday Inn - very blah and non-descript.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the subway, good bed.”
Reviews.Author: Daffe
Reviews.Content: A bit overpriced, but this was were the conference I was attending were, so therefore I stayed there. The check-in personal was effective and polite. I had a room just a few rooms from the main entrance and this room was quite good. The bed was very good, but Internet was expensive. Cleaning was good, but started a bit early and I woke up several times of people cleaning other rooms in the hallway. The breakfast was good but overpriced, as expected. The hotel felt close to the airport because of the noise from the planes.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Bad for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: michtraveler1969
Reviews.Content: This is quite possibly the worst Marriott i personally have experienced. This place is old and not maintained as well as most Marriott's. Check in was fast and friendly and the lobby area was nice. We were assigned a room in the older two story motor lodge type of accommodations which really didn't bother me. The carpeting in the hallways leading to the maze of rooms in this section was very old but clean. The room was shockingly bad for a Marriott. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and actually had a spring sticking out. Not only did i wake up feeling like i was sleeping on a pin but it had poked a hole clear through the sheet. In addition to this the tv was small and outdated as was the bathroom. The food in the restaurant was bland and overpriced as you'd expect. There are much better choices that are more updated and closer to O'Hare. I'll definately try one of those next time.

Reviews.Title: “generic marriott”
Reviews.Author: lighthouseboy
Reviews.Content: Ok, I got it on priceline for $42 so I can't complain too much. Bed/pillows were great but the TV was in a cabinet at eye level (which I thought unusual) and it wasn't a flat screen (I figure Marriott was fairly upscale to not have tube TVs). $6.95/hr for internet in the business center is robbery (yet their Courtyard brand is free). I ordered breakfast from room service and it was quickier than promised (a plus) and it was really good. Two pluses for the hotel: The "L" is nearby and so is Dominick's which has a decent salad bar.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: Folklorist
Reviews.Content: Although I booked the room through Priceline at a very favorable rate, I was treated very well by the Marriott staff. My eighth-floor room had a great view of the surrounding area, and was clean and comfortable. I also enjoyed the large indoor/outdoor pool and whirlpool. Another advantage is the ease of getting on the CTA's Blue Line; the entrance to the Cumberland station is located just across the hotel's parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravellers
Reviews.Content: The guy that I spoke to at the front desk when I arrived could not give me any substantial information about the shuttle, so I took a taxi, since the hotel is 2 miles from the airport. The taxi cost me $18, and he said it's about 6 miles from the airport. The room was small, the furniture scratched, and a lamp had the bulb hanging down in a dangerous way. The towels and shower curtain smelled of cigarette smoke, even though this is a non smoking hotel. And, I've stayed at many airport Marriott (most way closer to the airport than this one) and have never felt the planes quite the way I did here. I did speak with the manager and he covered my dinner. But that doesn't make up for the poor quality of this non-airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not "AT" Airport, more suburban”
Reviews.Author: SSwank
Reviews.Content: Marriott guarantees the lowest prices if you book through them. It's not cheap but it's a major city. It is in Chicago but it is really a suburban location. Did not need a car, there is a shuttle from the airport and the train into downtown is located right across the parking lot. Nice/safe neighborhood for walking - Woodsy area close by. A few restaurants are on site. Not much right around the hotel, nothing to walk to as far as attractions. It was a bit of a walk but I did walk to a grocery store and pharmacy and fast food restaurant in the area, Although if you did have a car the highway is right there and there are things to do in the area. Staff was very nice. Rooms nice but run of the mill. Lobby was pretty, beautiful fresh flowers. Buffett breakfast was very good, Gift shop was nicer than many hotels. I did not use, but the pool looks very nice and it looks like if it was summer the poolside rooms would be very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Donna8708
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the O'Hare Marriott a dozen times over the last few years while in Chicago on business. I have found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. On one trip, I called down to the front desk asking for ginger ale and crackers during a bout an upset stomach. Even though room service was closed, the security guard ran up a can of soda and crackers and emphasized that I should call if I needed anything else. The bell stand staff for wonderful and the banquet staff are professional. The AV staff know their business and have always had the equipment I needed ready to go when I arrived for my meeting. While the rooms are nothing special, they are clean, relaxing, and well equipped. I've never had any trouble with noise from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1015
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott O'Hare for one night for a meeting. The hotel seems old and needs updating. The meeting space was nice enough and the catering was pretty good for a hotel. My problem was more with the guestrooms, which were small, had outdated furniture, and could have been cleaner. Would not want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Greedy”
Reviews.Author: kellen1
Reviews.Content: Their web site shows High-speed internet in guest rooms in the amenities along with pool, shuttle, etc. But what they don't tell you is they rip you off for $13 for internet. And if that isn't enough, they charge 1/2 day for a late checkout. When every coffee shop in town and the $60 hotels can provide internet for free, there is no excuse for a $200 room to charge an extra $13 for internet and have charges for the "business center". And for the price they charge, you'd think the TV would be above bed height but it is actually below your feet, so you can see most of the screen but have to hold the remote up over your head just to change the channel. Oh, but they have a bottle of water in the room if you need it-for only $5.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but ok”
Reviews.Author: clbd
Reviews.Content: Received an email from Marriott ebreaks and thought we would take a short end of the summer trip to Chicago to see their Air and Water show since the rate at this hotel was good ($89 a night). We have stayed here in the past and found it nice enought and convienent since it is right on the edge of Chicago and less than a block away from an El station making it easily accessible to downtown Chicago without having to drive and park in downtown Chicago. The hotel room was ok and we had a king room (Rm 303). This room faces the interstate, and the El train tracks, and O'Hare airport so there is a lot of traffic noise, train noise, and take off and landing noise. We live in the Minneapolis area so were not overly worried but it was noisy. It is noisier still in the hallway though. The second night of our stay a wedding party had a room down the hall and we had to call security three different times to come and quiet the group. Made it fairly miserable for settling down that night but we blamed ourselves as a "you get what you pay for" deal. There is a large window overlooking a deck but you cannot open the door (probably to keep down the noise) too. It was a bit strange since usually patio type windows open. The pool here is one of their more interesting features since it is an indoor/outdoor pool and you can swim underneath a barrier to move between pools. Our eight year old loved it but the pool is getting more worn out and needs maintenence that the hotel doesn't seem to care about. In one place in the indoor part it looks like mold is growing on the side of the pool. The pool is warmer than most swimming pools on the plus side and is 12 feet deep, and long enough to do laps both inside and outside. We probably would stay here again but will ask for a room not facing the interstate or higher up so the traffic noise and El noise isn't as noticeable. A final thing to note is that the hotel charges you $20 a night to park. Not unusual for city hotels but since it was more than 20% over the cost of the hotel it is worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “upsad”
Reviews.Author: terrywa
Reviews.Content: i m not the kind of person who like to complaint.but this stay upsad me a lot,a lot! i wont go back and i dont recommend you to stay as welll i m gonna tell my story now: PS: it would be a bit long!! i stayed there from 23rd to 25th of may. at first ,i thought i m gonna stay only one night!! but i changed my mind and called the front desk agent for extending my stay!! she transfered me to the 1800 reservation hotline!! the reservationist ask many questionsss...and she asked me if i want any extra towel in the room cos i emphasized that i would stay in the same room!!! i called back to the front desk agent and told her that i have already made the reservation and i m going to stay in the same room!! she said" fine" and she was nice!! then i went out and came back around 5pm, i approached the Front desk and met the front office manager named Sawsan. i told her what had happened about the extended reservation. She started to ask me many questions cause she said she couldnt find anything in her computer,she said "there is no reservation of yours"............... finally she said she found and surprisingly she gave me a new room key!! haha!!! she is ridiculous!! she doesnt even listen to me!! i would like to stay in the old room!!!!!!!!! then i told her that all my stuff is still in the room and i would like to stay in the same room. she then called housekeeping using a radio,one of the things that she mentioned upsad me a lot,she blamed me of not going to the front desk and check out the first night of staying!!!!!!!!!!! ((( she talked on the radio with somebody from housekeeping not directly to me,but for sure,she means what she said))) she finished the call and i immediately clarified that i extended my stay and nobody ask me to come to check out ! i m angry but i still use gentle tone of course, she said "OK" as a reply.she is not happy with what i said as well i think, then she keeps her eyes and hands on the computer and didnt tell me anything and i stand there waiting for around 2 mins,hoping she will tell me somethings ,but didint !! after 2 min of stipud waiting ,then she said i m waiting for the call from housekeeping,they are going to check ur room ((( you should have told me that when you finish the call with housekeeping,then i can get a seat ,right????i m so upsad of her attitude!!))) this kind of attitude and behaviour is marriott standard?? you are not qualify ! and she never say even one sorry to me!! i think i did everything right!! this is totally their communication problem!! they have a chaotic system!!

Reviews.Title: “Average overall”
Reviews.Author: emdoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice over the past 2 months. My first stay was in the "motel" section. This property has a 12-story main tower and connected to it two square-shaped "motel" that is 3-stories high. The "motel" section has open balconies with chairs where you could sit facing central courtyards. One courtyard contains the outside part of the indoor/outdoor pool. The other courtyard has a seasonal outdoor pool which was covered during my stay. My second stay was on the 12-floor of the main tower. From the balcony window facing the airport I could see planes coming in on their approach and almost see them land. In the distance I would see planes take off. Unfortunately the balcony door did not open, probably due to liability concerns. Perhaps in years past, before people became sue-happy, guests could step outside and enjoy the breeze. Now the balcony looks neglected, worn, and dirty. The noise from the planes is noticeable in the room and occurred on a regular basis during the day (just about every 5 minutes). Even though I was on the top floor, I could also hear the traffic from the nearby freeway. I'm not a light sleeper so none of the noise really bothered me. The rooms in the tower and the "motel" were very similar. Neither roomy nor small. For some reason the ceiling in the bathroom was lower than in the room and the bathroom was definitely tight. You kind of have to step out of the way to open and close the bathroom door. I felt a little claustrophobic. On my second stay, 2 of the lights would not work. It turns out both were not plugged in; something the housekeeping staff should have checked. Otherwise everything worked as expected. I will agree with previous reviewers that this hotel is a bit dated. I can see that areas of renovation and modernization have taken place over the years but clearly there's only so much that can be done to an older property. The public areas, such as the lobby, meeting rooms, and restaurants look nice but the remaining areas, corridors, and rooms are dated and worn. I did not use the pool but it looked nice and was used by many guests. I did use the gym which was located at the very end of the "motel" section away from the tower. The gym had a nice selection of aerobic machines and some weight machines as well as some dumbells. Every one of the staff I encountered was professional, friendly, and helpful. The airport shuttle service during my first stay was frequent and prompt. The shuttle does stop at the Marriott Suites first from the airport and then makes a stop there on the way to the airport. If you have a choice between staying here or at the Marriott Suites, I would recommend the latter. My second stay, I self-parked which cost $20 with unlimited in-and-out privileges. I would probably choose another place to stay if I was in the area in the future. However, if you can get a decent room rate, this is not a bad choice, as long as you can put up with its "retro" style.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay for business trip at conference rate”
Reviews.Author: deardiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a meeting being held at the hotel. The one thing this hotel has going for it, is location. The El train - into downtown is within short walking distance, the airport is quickly accessed by shuttle, the convention ctr is about 2 miles away and freeway access, is just around the corner. On the downside, this hotel appears to have been built in the 60's. We were in a room located on the west wing (3 floors only) as opposed to the main tower. It reminded me of staying in a motel, only it was much larger. With elevators by the main lobby, it was quite a walk to our room, something reminiscent of large Las Vegas hotels. In addition, while we entered the room from an inside hallway, the room has an additional door that led to a shared walkway on the outside. If you did not draw the heavy drapes, the inside could be seen even with the sheer drapes closed. Because of this, most of the time it was kept closed, making it darker in the room. While the furnishings in the room were outdated and worn, the bed was newer and very comfortable. I must admit, the very old crystal lamps gave me a chuckle. I haven't seen those, since I was a kid in the 70's. Because the bed was quite high, it was difficult seeing the tv, which was placed so low in the armoire. The bathroom was tiny, but clean. The toiletries were quite nice - Bath and Bodyworks Aromatherapy. Staff was always courteous and friendly. The sports lounge had good food and the small gift shop was convenient. The internet is not free as they say on their website. And parking was outrageous at $20 considering the huge uncovered lot in the front. All in all, at the conference rate, it was ok.
