Given a choice and for the same price, I would probably pick the Embassy Suites down the road, where I've stayed before.

Reviews.Title: “Another Sub Par Chicagoland Marriott”
Reviews.Author: vaznayak
Reviews.Content: Another Chicagoland Marriott property that's overrated for a Marriott. The hotel has a motel feel to it - it's very constructed like one. The rooms are just OK, and the bathrooms tiny. The only saving grace is a comfortable bed. But that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Should Be Embarrassed”
Reviews.Author: ScottDC
Reviews.Content: The reviewer who described this place as a 1970's Holiday Inn with a Marriott sign was right, except Holiday Inns were nicer. There is no soundproofing, and since it's on the westward approach to ORD, not to mention next to the Kennedy Expwy, it's incredibly noisy. The overall look is dated. The HVAC is old, the carpet is worn, the bathrooms are tiny and the internet connection was slow. It's just not up to Marriott standards. A few good aspects - the staff was incredibly friendly and for the most part, very dedicated. The gym had new cardio equipment (though it seems like a good 1/4 mile walk from the main elevators, and was a bit small given the size of the hotel). The banquet food was, somewhat surprisingly, creative. But the place needs a physical makeover. The only truly positive thing about this place is that Gino's East pizza is right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Intruder tried to enter my room at 1am”
Reviews.Author: RooRoo8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in 2004 for a seminar, and was booked for 4 nights. During my first (and only) night at this hotel, I stayed up late to catch up on reading and went to bed about 1am. About 1:30 am I heard light knocking (I figured someone was knocking on another door down the hall), then about 20 seconds later, my door OPENED UP (I had the security bolt on, preventing the door from opening all the way). I quickly screamed for the intruder to get out of my room, and immediately called the front desk (panicked out of my mind) asking for a security guard, and they agreed to send one up. No one ever arrived. After half an hour, my nerves calmed and I packed my bags and went to the front desk - telling them what happened - and demanded a full refund. The staff all just looked at me not knowing what to say. They had NO explanation why no security guard every arrived at my room. They DID tell me that this must have been a hotel employee checking to see if the room was vacant. Really. I find that a bit hard to believe. What I know is this: someone (who knows who) had a key to my room, and the light knocking must have been on MY door, to see if I was awake. Clearly I would have been robbed, or worse, had I been totally asleep when the intruder entered my room. Interestingly, when I wrote to Marriott asking for an explanation, I NEVER received a response. I am a female who travels alone. This is the ONLY hotel I have ever stayed at that I would FEAR staying at again as I believe their security is nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Needs major renovation”
Reviews.Author: bethrenrel
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Marriott's, and are usually quite happy. This time we were extremely disappointed. We tried two different rooms, and both had a horrible cigarette smell, mildew in the walls, and damp carpeting. Looks like it needs a major renovation, not just new pillows and bedding. While the staff was helpful and the location convenient to the El, the hotel was gross. We will still stay at another Marriott, but never again this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but to far”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSuzie
Reviews.Content: My familly and I stayed at this Mariott on aug 21st 2007. We tough the Mariott was OK but we found it far from down town. We used the El-train to go down town and it took over an hour. The hotel needs renovation but the concierge service was excellent. If you don't have to be down town it's a nice and quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: RoadJunkie
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott at O'Hare was sort of a last-minute decision. Because of circumstances, my wife and I really needed a hotel close to the airport so we could just catch the shuttle the next morning. I tend to stay at Marriott hotels because they are pretty reliable. I knew the cost would be high, and it was, but I was willing to pay it. But it was really just an average hotel. I was surprised that our room was in essentially a dressed-up "motel". There was nothing terrible about it, our stay was pleasant enough, just not up to what I expect from Marriott, and definitely not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to L, O'Hare, and expressways”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBoomer
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a mini-vacation over Memorial Day weekend. I wanted access to downtown Chicago's shopping, dining, and culture. The hotel is only a 5-minute walk from the Cumberland L station. That let me go downtown without worrying about auto traffic and parking. However, the Blue Line was undergoing renovation, and the trip seemed closer to an hour than the usual 45 minutes. Also, I wanted access to visit family outside the city. The hotel is barely a block or two from the Cumberland I-90 exit. In addition, I was flying out of O'Hare. I don't think it took me more than 10 minutes to drive from the hotel to the Hertz car return. So the hotel met my key expectation: convenient location. My Hertz reservation led me to a special deal for that weekend. I stayed three nights at a $109 base rate, but the special deal meant that I only had to pay for the first two nights. I'm glad I brought the Internet printout explaining the special deal. At both check-in and check-out, the clerks were unfamiliar with it. However, both times they took my printout to the manager. After a few minutes, they came back and honored the special deal. I did have to pay for wired Internet ($12.95/night) and self-parking ($16.75/night). My room was in the tower, which was close to the lobby. However, parts of the hotel are some distance away. The walk to the fitness center was roughly 5 minutes. On the way there, I noticed two men starting their workout by running through the hallway to the fitness center. That made sense since the distance was so great. The fitness center itself was uncrowded during my visits. An elliptical-type cardiovascular machine worked well and had a built-in tv; I had to bring my own headphones to listen to the sound. The center also has weight machines, and the hotel has indoor and outdoor pools. The room itself was generally typical of other Marriotts where I've stayed in size, decor, and general condition. In other words, it was adequate, with no significant problems but no especially exciting features. The king bed did seem to reflect the recent trend toward a soft, complicated set of bedding with lots of pillows. Although the hotel was close to O'Hare and I occasionally heard airplanes, I was able to sleep undisturbed by noise. I encountered uniformly friendly and helpful staff--including the bellman at the front door, the maid, and the parking lot attendant. They seemed genuinely eager to help. They lacked the stiff formality of a Ritz-Carlton, and they lacked the seemingly clairvoyant anticipation of my needs I had found at the W City Center in Chicago on an earlier trip. Overall, I was pleased with the hotel's convenient location, great rates, adequate facilities, and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was like a cave.”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadTraveler
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in suites when we travel for more space to work and stretch out. We had to fly into Chicago unexpectedly due to a family emergency and as I usually stay at Marriott hotels, I did a quick search. My brother in law said the Marriott Hotel O'Hare was closest to the hospital of the hotels Marriott listed so I booked a suite at almost $250 night, plus huge tax rate and parking. I requested a top floor, expecting their suites to be on the top of their tower building. Instead they are on the third floor of the old 1970's style holiday inn building that surrounds the pools. (Which did look pretty nice). After walking what seemed like forever we walked down a musty smelling hallway, which they were carpet cleaning at the time. (really strong smell). The suite itself was an ok size, but the room has only one large plate glass window that opened to a set of stairs from the outside parking lot (no sense of security) and a walkway for access to some AMA building. Their is a huge overhang over this walkway, so natural light was almost non existent. The window and airconditioning were in the main living area, and the bed was tucked into a back corner with no window and no air vent. Freezing in the living area and hot on the bed. Go figure. The bathroom was tiny with barely enough room to turn around from the sink, toilet and worn out puny tub. The bed was saggy and lumpy and neither of us slept well. They throw a lumpy, prickly topper on the mattress and think it will account for a bad mattress. I must say that the front desk staff was very nice, but I immediately got online and booked the remainder of our stay at the Marriott Suites, which was just two minutes down the road. That is the place to stay. I hate to dish Marriott, because I am almost always happy with them, but this Marriott is not what I expected for the price and the name.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid, absolutely horrid”
Reviews.Author: flip_wilson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a last minute decision to do park n fly so we didn't have to leave home at 5am. The cost was $250 after tax. I might as well had flushed the money down the toilet. This hotel is a typical example of a respected name buying a dated, run down holiday inn from the 70's, slapping on a new coat of paint and calling it a marriott. To be fair, the public spaces are nicely renovated. The room, was a dump. We had to go through the pool area to get to it. The carpets were dirty and the bed was an absolute joke. Crappy sheets over a feather topper (I think they caught some chicken beaks in there) covering a 1980 walmart mattress. My wife and I slept about 2 hours total. I personally had marks on my body from the stupid feathera poking through the sheets. I am pissed at marriott for putting their name on this rats nest, and will definetly avoid the marriott name for quite some time. You can put lipstick on a pig...........but it's still a pig.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: misspipsy
Reviews.Content: I didn't know quite what to expect knowing the age of this hotel (I last stayed in it 26 years ago!), but we found it to be elegant, professional, with an extremely friendly and helpful staff. Every worker we encountered seemed to want to do all he or she could to ensure we had a great stay. I was pleasantly surprised by some of the little services, like offering to give us a follow-up wake up call ten minutes after the first call. The entire hotel, both common areas and our room, was furnished with lovely colors, textures, and furniture. All very comfortable, clean, and classy. The bathroom was the only place I noticed the hotel's age. The hotel seems to cater more to the business and convention traveler. Frequent shuttles to the airport and convention center looked to be very handy. With our own car, we didn't take advantage of the shuttles. We were surprised to pay $20 a night for parking with in/out privileges. We were also surprised to find the high speed internet is $12.95 plus tax each day. Our business schedule was packed so the only facility we were able to try was the restaurant for breakfast each morning. The service was top-notch. All in all we had a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Near-luxury large hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craig D
Reviews.Content: I was there Fri-Sun for a meeting held at the hotel. The first nice touch was a free shuttle from O'Hare that picks up every 30 minutes. Check-in was friendly and efficient - they make you aware this is a nonsmoking hotel. The room was quite a long walk away from the lobby - lots of hallways, corners - easy to get lost! Everything was clean and modern as in most Marriotts, and the bed was comfortable. A small patio looked out over the indoor/outdoor pool. This was neat at first but I couldn't go to sleep early because noisy kids were swimming until about 10 PM. There's a bar and a couple of restaurants. I had dinner at the Champion grill - a sports-themed place with countless big-screen TVs on the walls all tuned to different games. The food was good and reasonably priced. Meeting rooms were average. I visited the fitness room, which had plenty of equipment and individual TVs and free earphones on the cardio machines. I had a break so I wanted to take a walk in the neighborhood. The bell desk was helpful but said there was nothing to do or see around the hotel unless I wanted to take a cab or the train in to the city. I walked around anyway, and as they said there wasn't anything interesting to see or do. There is a large grocery store about a block away and I picked up a few snacks to eat in the room. The shuttle returned to the airport on schedule, rounding out a nice trip. In summary, this hotel is great for business in the area and there were a number of families having a good time, especially in the pool/spa area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 39StatesNcounting
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent three days in Seattle, then took Amtrak to Chicago. The Marriott was excellent! The beds were fresh and clean and comfy, especially after two nights on a train. But, they were extra nice anyway. The room was a nice size, too. Our room was very quiet, despite being near O'Hare Airport and having an indoor pool and a bunch of sorority sisters having a reunion in the ballroom. From our room, we would have never guessed anything was going on. The desk staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, would not select it again.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelTriad
Reviews.Content: Good Points of Hotel: *Free shuttle from Oâ€™Hare to the hotel; *Room had comfortable king bed with down-stuffed bedding; *Nice little shop (though pricey) in the lobby for snacks, sodas, and incidentals; *Room service staff very friendly and efficient; *Food from room service very good, and a few gluten-friendly items on the menu (such as the roast chicken) for those of us with gluten sensitivity; *Good heating system in the room; *USA Today newspaper; *Nice bathroom amenities (soap, shampoo). Bad Points of Hotel: *Long walk from the lobby to the room with several twists and turns, poorly laid out, and no help with luggage for your trek; *Carpeting in room significantly soiled, not willing to walk on it barefoot; *Several bulbs in the lamps burned out with cob webs covering the lamp shades; *Front desk staff cold and not very helpful; *Bathroom rather small; *Expensive internet access: Cost was $12.95 PER DAY! *Maid service entered the room to clean it despite a DO NOT DISTURB card was in the key slot; *Very limited t.v. options (only about 18 channels, the majority sports and news channels); *Be aware that this hotel IS near Oâ€™Hare Airport, and I could hear planes going over the hotel every 15 to 30 minutes; *If you do not have a car (as I did not), expect to pay for cab fare or take the train if you leave the hotel as there are no restaurants or other points of interest within walking distance of this hotel. Stayed here as an overflow hotel for a conference I attended. I have stayed at other Marriott Hotels, and this was my least favorite for service and accommodations. I would not opt to stay here again with so many other hotel options in the area, especially at $200 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: emindc
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in July 2006 for business. The room as well as the hotel in general are acceptable, but not up to the standards of the typical Marriott. The facilities seem to be rather old, and in need of more than a superficial redecorating. My room was on the ground floor in a wing overlooking the pool. I was nervous about noise, but this was not a problem once evening came. The bed was very comfortable with bountiful pillows and comforters. The furniture and carpeting looked to be well worn but clean. The only cleaning flaw I could see were "dust bunnies" in the corners of the bathroom floor (under the counter). I had difficulty adjusting the thermostat in the room -- the only choices seemed to be to blast the air conditioning to arctic level or endure dampness/humidity that left the mirror fogged (this was long before I took a shower, I should note!). Internet access is available for a fee. I didn't eat any meals at the hotel so I can't speak to their food offerings. I got a snack at the gift shop which has plenty of drinks and healthy snacks available. My colleague and I found the front desk staff to be somewhat less than helpful when we were seeking restaurant recommendations. The employee handed us a mimeographed sheets with restaurant options, but really couldn't tell us what was near or far, although she told us none were in walking distance. Airport-Hotel shuttle: We waited over half an hour at the airport bus area -- the shuttle seems to service a number of hotels so it can be slow at peak times. The CTA Blue Line is right next to the hotel premises. It was very easy to get downtown. Overall, it's okay, but a little less than I would expect from Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: valpete
Reviews.Content: Just recently staying 3 nights at the Chicago O'Hare Marriott. I had a king size room in the main tower. The bed was very comfy, clean sheets and very crisp. The rooms fairly decent size, but the bathroom was extremely small. Convinent location to the airport and the train downtown(only a 3 minute walk) as well as close to a local grocery store for supplies. The staff was friendly the morning breakfast buffet was good and lunch in the "Harvest" was also good. I did not self park, but did notice there was a fee. I got an early check in and the staff was very accomodating the entire trip when I needed them. I am a gold member with Marriott so I stay with them all over and this was about a 3 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Wish All Hotels Were Like This One”
Reviews.Author: MarciaM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Chicago O'Hare for 4 days. The hotel is beautiful and perfectly clean. The beds? Wow, the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in - I think I slept better in it that I do at home. The food at the restaurant, Harvest "something" was excellent. I was attending a seminar that had continental breakfast and lunch provided by the hotel - it was all so good! The coffee was very good, and if you're a coffee drinker, you know how important that is. Every hotel employee I encountered was very pleasant - very friendly and pleasant. The final thing I liked about this hotel was that we could control the temperature in our meeting room - nice! I enjoyed my stay very much and look forward to staying at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Was pleased as can be at the Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: cotomom
Reviews.Content: Arrived into O'hare from La Guardia too late and missed our connection home. Since we didn't know until very last minute (maybe 8pm), I had family member at home start working on getting us a hotel while we were in the air. We were able to get the LAST room at the Marriott O'hare. None were available at ANY of the other hotels he tried and he tried every online travel website as well as major hotel chain. O'hare airport is very confusing to find bus/shuttle center. Once you do finally find it, shuttle comes to door number 2. Shuttle takes about 15 minutes and stops at other Marriott properties first. Since we were checking in close to midnight, we were able to immediately and the staff was very helpful and kind. We had no luggage as it had gone on an earlier flight so they gave us some toiletries and robes which I found very nice! We requested room service breakfast during a 15 minute time spread and a wake up call. We discovered the next morning that our room clock was set to an incorrect time, but the wake up call saved us and arrived on time. Breakfast was nicely presented but arrived right on the dot of the final moment of the 15 min. time block. A bit pricey but we were tired and it was better than eating in the airport. Shuttle runs every 20 minutes on the hour and they are prompt. No problems to mention, room was overlooking the pool, nice and quiet, clean, the beds were comfortable, sheets and towels nice and soft. Room rate at the last possible moment was $199/night but saved me from sleeping at the airport. Would've rather pricelined for lower but I thought it was worth it in this case!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Still Feels Dingy”
Reviews.Author: bartleby000
Reviews.Content: Despite their best efforts to make this hotel adhere to Marriott standards, this hotel falls a bit short. Despite furniture typical for the chain, the rooms were only fair. Little irritations such as walking into the room and finding the temperature to be somehwere north of 80 degrees (heat set on high). The hallways felt dim and underlit, and not in a fashionable way. My room was an unreasonably long walk from the lobby, as you have to walk throught the pool atrium (!). Most people would find it to be an approximately 10 minute walk. The staff was surpisingly pleasant and helpful even by Marriott standards. The food in the restaurant was decent but typically pricey. The airport shuttle leaves every 15 minutes and was on-time. The room internet access was $12/day and wired only (not wireless), so there's no surfing from bed . Overall, I felt that the Orbitz room rate ~$145 was a decent value for this hotel. A luxurious rest spot it isn't, but it is a reasonable place to crash near O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Wonderful staff, from the Bell staff to the servers and bartenders. (Especially the bartenders!). Inside/outside pool is great. Gym a tad small, but I hear a remodel will happen soon. Two bars, one restaurant. The restaurant serves a very nice steak, with a suprisingly good wine list. Meeting room areas also are pleasant. Shuttle to O'Hare is great. Save a rental car and get on blue line CTA to 'Cumberland' stop and it is a short walk to this hotel. Minutes away from fine Rosemont restaurants too. (Go to Harry Caray's for the bar, but get your steak at Morton's). Fine hotel for business or pleasure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay for Catching Early Flight Next Day”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had no problems and the service was excellent. We will definitely use this hotel again if we need to catch an early flight from Oâ€™Hare. The room was really nice with a fluffy bed. We didnâ€™t go to the pool, but it looked nice as we could see it from our balcony. We ate at the sports bar and had great service. The prices were a little high, but it was expected. It is free to park, so the cost of the room more than covered what it would have cost us to park at the airport. I would recommend this hotel for people needing to park and fly or even visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: goldensnake7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mariott because I was participating in a music festival with my high school concert band. The lobby is nice, and there's a lot of conference rooms and a place where you can make copies and send things. Be sure to check out the map of the hotel - if you don't find the elevator closer to your room, it could mean a lot of unnecessary walking. I had a room with two double beds, and they were kind of small, but they're able to fit two average-sized people. The bathroom is kind of small also, and there's no ventilation system, but its clean - no mildew or anything. The pool is a lot better than most hotels - there's a glass dome, and you can swim outside or inside in one big pool. The maids and front desk were nice, and fulfilled all of my requests. The hotel has some drawbacks but overall it is a good place to stay. I would rate it 3.5 stars if that was possible.

Reviews.Title: “Flies and dust”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at this hotel in November 04 because of an exam being held there. Our room had fly after fly after fly that I kept trying to catch and throw out, but kept finding more behind the curtains along the window. After a while, I gave up and had us moved to a handicap-friendly room, which was more spacious but louder (being closer to the elevator). This was better, although the dust in this hotel is unbelievable (you could see a haze whereever you walked), and I think I developed allergies just from my 2 days there. The gym was spacious (lots of treadmills and TVs) and the pool was nice (although you can't do laps because of the depth and odd shape) and the hottub is way too small. Overall, two thumbs down; not worth the price or location by ANY means.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for travel and long term parking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel very convenient for flying out of Ohare. Shuttle to airport is timely and cost of fly and park package was much cheaper then parking at airport during our 10 day trip. Our wait for the shuttle upon returning was only about 10-15 minutes and since we traveled during January it was nice to sit in the hotel lobby while our car warmed up. The rooms were fine, pool area nice and they had a fun sports bar at lobby level that helped kick off our vacation feeling!
